shortdesc.p: CWRC is an online research environment that brings together scholarly materials and digital tools.

topicmeta.shortdesc: CWRC is an online research environment that brings together scholarly materials and digital tools.

shortdesc.p: The organization, creation, and upload of materials relies on content models. These define the parameters of a subcollection, determining if you can add a subcollection and what type of material can be added.

topicmeta.shortdesc: The organization, creation, and upload of materials relies on content models. These define the parameters of a subcollection, determining if you can add a subcollection and what type of material can be added.

shortdesc.p: CWRC users have different levels of access to their projects. This ranges from non-members who can only view the materials on CWRC to project administrators who have complete control over project materials.

topicmeta.shortdesc: CWRC users have different levels of access to their projects. This ranges from non-members who can only view the materials on CWRC to project administrators who have complete control over project materials.

shortdesc.p: CWRC utilizes a robust search system to make the contents of the site as accessible and explorable as possible.

topicmeta.shortdesc: CWRC utilizes a robust search system to make the contents of the site as accessible and explorable as possible.

shortdesc.p: The Menu Bar is located at the top of any CWRC page and provides points of navigation into the CWRC site, including (from left to right): CWRC home page, Collaboratory, News, About, Projects, Help icon, Language Settings icon, Notifications icon, and Profile icon.

topicmeta.shortdesc: The Menu Bar is located at the top of any CWRC page and provides points of navigation into the CWRC site, including (from left to right): CWRC home page, Collaboratory, News, About, Projects, Help icon, Language Settings icon, Notifications icon, and Profile icon.

shortdesc.p: How you view files in CWRC depends on the file itself. XML documents are viewed in the visualization tool CWRC-Writer. Image, audio, video, and document files open within your browser. For more information see Content Models Reference.

topicmeta.shortdesc: How you view files in CWRC depends on the file itself. XML documents are viewed in the visualization tool CWRC-Writer. Image, audio, video, and document files open within your browser. For more information see Content Models Reference.

shortdesc.p: CWRC provides users with a search and advanced search functions. Searchable items include projects, collection, files and topics of interest.

topicmeta.shortdesc: CWRC provides users with a search and advanced search functions. Searchable items include projects, collection, files and topics of interest.

shortdesc.p: CWRC is still in development, which means that you may discover some bugs. Follow these steps to report an issue:

topicmeta.shortdesc: CWRC is still in development, which means that you may discover some bugs. Follow these steps to report an issue:

shortdesc.p: CWRC provides a customizable user experience for members. Members of CWRC can upload, edit, and explore digital texts.

topicmeta.shortdesc: CWRC provides a customizable user experience for members. Members of CWRC can upload, edit, and explore digital texts.

shortdesc.p: Once you have a CWRC account, you can request to join different participating projects. Project content is available to view if you are not a member, but, depending to the file lock, you may not be able to edit or annotate. Here is how to submit a request:

topicmeta.shortdesc: Once you have a CWRC account, you can request to join different participating projects. Project content is available to view if you are not a member, but, depending to the file lock, you may not be able to edit or annotate. Here is how to submit a request:

shortdesc.p: You can use the visualization tool, PlotIt, in CWRC. This feature works with your bookmark lists to map and date the files that you have bookmarked.

topicmeta.shortdesc: You can use the visualization tool, PlotIt, in CWRC. This feature works with your bookmark lists to map and date the files that you have bookmarked.

shortdesc.p: Project homepages display the project's description. This can include a link to the entire collection, featured items from the collection, external links to the project's website and/or social media page, list of sponsors, director(s) names, and an About Me page that lists the project's contact information.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Project homepages display the project's description. This can include a link to the entire collection, featured items from the collection, external links to the project's website and/or social media page, list of sponsors, director(s) names, and an About Me page that lists the project's contact information.

shortdesc.p: Welcome to CWRC-Writer. In this page we describe how to get started using the editor and what to look out for.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Welcome to CWRC-Writer. In this page we describe how to get started using the editor and what to look out for.

shortdesc.p: Git-Writer is a web-based XML&LOD editor that supports editing of XML documents storred in GitHub.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Git-Writer is a web-based XML&LOD editor that supports editing of XML documents storred in GitHub.

shortdesc.p: In order to edit a document in Git-Writer, you must load it first. You can load a documnet from GitHub or you local machine. You can also start editing from one of the templates provided.

topicmeta.shortdesc: In order to edit a document in Git-Writer, you must load it first. You can load a documnet from GitHub or you local machine. You can also start editing from one of the templates provided.

shortdesc.p: CWRC users can view any uploaded XML documents in CWRC-Writer. If the document is locked by another user, you cannot edit or annotated the document until you get the other users premission.

topicmeta.shortdesc: CWRC users can view any uploaded XML documents in CWRC-Writer. If the document is locked by another user, you cannot edit or annotated the document until you get the other users premission.

shortdesc.p: The reference materials available explain, in detail, components of CWRC-Writer.

topicmeta.shortdesc: The reference materials available explain, in detail, components of CWRC-Writer.

shortdesc.p: There are three different tabs on the left hand side of CWRC-Writer.

topicmeta.shortdesc: There are three different tabs on the left hand side of CWRC-Writer.

shortdesc.p: We have included overall concepts in our CWRC-Writer documentation as background information for the user. This includes information on XML, RDF, Named Entity Annotation, and Relations/Triples.

topicmeta.shortdesc: We have included overall concepts in our CWRC-Writer documentation as background information for the user. This includes information on XML, RDF, Named Entity Annotation, and Relations/Triples.

shortdesc.p: CWRC-Writer allows users to markup their document with eXtensible Markup Language (XML). In this document, we provide an overall description of XML.

topicmeta.shortdesc: CWRC-Writer allows users to markup their document with eXtensible Markup Language (XML). In this document, we provide an overall description of XML.

shortdesc.p: CWRC-Writer allows users to markup their document with Resource Description Framework (RDF). In this document, we provide an overall description of RDF.

topicmeta.shortdesc: CWRC-Writer allows users to markup their document with Resource Description Framework (RDF). In this document, we provide an overall description of RDF.

shortdesc.p: CWRC-Writer allows users to markup their document with Named Entity Annotations. In this document, we provide an overall description of it.

topicmeta.shortdesc: CWRC-Writer allows users to markup their document with Named Entity Annotations. In this document, we provide an overall description of it.

shortdesc.p: CWRC-Writer allows users to markup their document with Triples. In this document we provide and overall description of RDF triples.

topicmeta.shortdesc: CWRC-Writer allows users to markup their document with Triples. In this document we provide and overall description of RDF triples.

topic.title: Overview of Dynamic Table of Contexts

topicmeta.navtitle: Overview of Dynamic Table of Contexts
topicmeta.linktext: Overview of Dynamic Table of Contexts

shortdesc.p: The Table of Contents presents the section or chapter breakdown of your document.

topicmeta.shortdesc: The Table of Contents presents the section or chapter breakdown of your document.

topic.title: Left column of Dynamic Table of Context

shortdesc.p: This column allow users to search and browse the document through the use of key terms, tags, and word frequencies.

topicmeta.navtitle: Left column of Dynamic Table of Context
topicmeta.linktext: Left column of Dynamic Table of Context
topicmeta.shortdesc: This column allow users to search and browse the document through the use of key terms, tags, and word frequencies.

shortdesc.p: Please feel free to download the DToC XML template or ignore it, depending on your XML expertise and/or adventurous spirit.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Please feel free to download the DToC XML template or ignore it, depending on your XML expertise and/or adventurous spirit.

shortdesc.p: DToC provides different features to share and save your document for future use.

topicmeta.shortdesc: DToC provides different features to share and save your document for future use.

topic.title: Navigating text in the table of contents

shortdesc.p: The Table of Contents displays terms selected from the left column, and lets users move through the text by clicking on them. This allows for in-depth exploration of terms without the trouble of scrolling through the corpus manually.

topicmeta.navtitle: Navigating text in the table of contents
topicmeta.linktext: Navigating text in the table of contents
topicmeta.shortdesc: The Table of Contents displays terms selected from the left column, and lets users move through the text by clicking on them. This allows for in-depth exploration of terms without the trouble of scrolling through the corpus manually.

shortdesc.p: The Document Model is a deconstructed version of your document. Each section of grey lines represents a different section, chapter, or article within the document.

topicmeta.shortdesc: The Document Model is a deconstructed version of your document. Each section of grey lines represents a different section, chapter, or article within the document.

shortdesc.p: The text in the Reading Pane is separated into chapters, sections, or articles by the XML document. The Reading Pane loads individual sections; the entire document will not appear unless no text divisions have been embedded into the document.

topicmeta.shortdesc: The text in the Reading Pane is separated into chapters, sections, or articles by the XML document. The Reading Pane loads individual sections; the entire document will not appear unless no text divisions have been embedded into the document.

topic.title: Filtering index terms, tags, and stats

shortdesc.p: The Search feature narrows down terms automatically as you type. The string of characters being entered into into the Search bar will bring up words containing that string, regardless of whether the word begins with those characters or not.

topicmeta.navtitle: Filtering index terms, tags, and stats
topicmeta.linktext: Filtering index terms, tags, and stats
topicmeta.shortdesc: The Search feature narrows down terms automatically as you type. The string of characters being entered into into the Search bar will bring up words containing that string, regardless of whether the word begins with those characters or not.

shortdesc.p: The search box is autocomplete-enabled.

topicmeta.shortdesc: The search box is autocomplete-enabled.

shortdesc.p: When you move between different tabs in the left column they will not be filtered by the Chapter you have selected in the previous column. However, when you return to the initial tab, the chapter filter will remain selected.

topicmeta.shortdesc: When you move between different tabs in the left column they will not be filtered by the Chapter you have selected in the previous column. However, when you return to the initial tab, the chapter filter will remain selected.

shortdesc.p: You can customize how you view word frequencies in DToC by different organizational headings and by how the words are displayed under those headings.

topicmeta.shortdesc: You can customize how you view word frequencies in DToC by different organizational headings and by how the words are displayed under those headings.

topic.title: Viewing stats by chapters and collections

topicmeta.navtitle: Viewing stats by chapters and collections
topicmeta.linktext: Viewing stats by chapters and collections

shortdesc.p: You can add as many terms as you would like to your “Favorites” list, either all at once or a few at a time.

topicmeta.shortdesc: You can add as many terms as you would like to your “Favorites” list, either all at once or a few at a time.

shortdesc.p: You can add context to your annotations using the "AnnotateIt" tool. For more information about signing up to “AnnotateIt” see “Login/Annotator Authentication.”

topicmeta.shortdesc: You can add context to your annotations using the "AnnotateIt" tool. For more information about signing up to “AnnotateIt” see “Login/Annotator Authentication.”

shortdesc.p: The left column has a list of the tags found in the document. You can add new tags to the list, regardless of whether they have been included in your XML document or not.

topicmeta.shortdesc: The left column has a list of the tags found in the document. You can add new tags to the list, regardless of whether they have been included in your XML document or not.

topic.title: Creating an XML document for the Dynamic Table of Contexts

shortdesc.p: In the Dynamic Table of Contexts (DToC) users can upload their own XML text. These XML documents need to be specially formatted in order to experience the full range of capabilities provided by DToC.

topicmeta.navtitle: Creating an XML document for the Dynamic Table of Contexts
topicmeta.linktext: Creating an XML document for the Dynamic Table of Contexts
topicmeta.shortdesc: In the Dynamic Table of Contexts (DToC) users can upload their own XML text. These XML documents need to be specially formatted in order to experience the full range of capabilities provided by DToC.

topic.title: Adding XML ids to your document manually

shortdesc.p: DToC uses XML ids as index locators. Every index item is associated with one or more paragraphs; their function is analogous to that of page numbers used in print indexes.

topicmeta.navtitle: Adding XML ids to your document manually
topicmeta.linktext: Adding XML ids to your document manually
topicmeta.shortdesc: DToC uses XML ids as index locators. Every index item is associated with one or more paragraphs; their function is analogous to that of page numbers used in print indexes.

shortdesc.p: This option is best for large DToC documents. The downside of using oXygen to insert IDs is that they are not human readable. It may be worth using the tool, if you are able to use a script to transform the ID pattern.

topicmeta.shortdesc: This option is best for large DToC documents. The downside of using oXygen to insert IDs is that they are not human readable. It may be worth using the tool, if you are able to use a script to transform the ID pattern.

topic.title: Adding an index to your XML document

shortdesc.p: DToC is best configured for documents that have indexes.

topicmeta.navtitle: Adding an index to your XML document
topicmeta.linktext: Adding an index to your XML document
topicmeta.shortdesc: DToC is best configured for documents that have indexes.

shortdesc.p: Cross referencing allows you to draw connections between terms found in different sections or chapters of your document.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Cross referencing allows you to draw connections between terms found in different sections or chapters of your document.

topic.title: Uploading your XML document to DToC

shortdesc.p: The information below is for an XML document that follows the template structure.

topicmeta.navtitle: Uploading your XML document to DToC
topicmeta.linktext: Uploading your XML document to DToC
topicmeta.shortdesc: The information below is for an XML document that follows the template structure.

topic.title: Uploading text and URLs into DToC

shortdesc.p: Some features will be unavailable using this method (like the index).

topicmeta.navtitle: Uploading text and URLs into DToC
topicmeta.linktext: Uploading text and URLs into DToC
topicmeta.shortdesc: Some features will be unavailable using this method (like the index).

shortdesc.p: Welcome to Plot-It. Here we describe how to get started using Plot-It and what to look out for.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Welcome to Plot-It. Here we describe how to get started using Plot-It and what to look out for.

shortdesc.p: The timeline displays events organized by the date they occurred. This information can be navigated two different ways, by year or by decade.

topicmeta.shortdesc: The timeline displays events organized by the date they occurred. This information can be navigated two different ways, by year or by decade.

shortdesc.p: The map feature in Plot-It allows users to view the geographical information of the events found in the timeline.

topicmeta.shortdesc: The map feature in Plot-It allows users to view the geographical information of the events found in the timeline.

shortdesc.p: To learn more information about the events, click on an icon in the timeline or map. The metadata/description for that event will appear in the text box located in the middle of Plot-It, and users are able to scroll through the information.

topicmeta.shortdesc: To learn more information about the events, click on an icon in the timeline or map. The metadata/description for that event will appear in the text box located in the middle of Plot-It, and users are able to scroll through the information.

topic.title: View events not in the map

shortdesc.p: If an event does not have a location attached to it, then it does not appear in the map. You can view these events in alternate ways.

topicmeta.navtitle: View events not in the map
topicmeta.linktext: View events not in the map
topicmeta.shortdesc: If an event does not have a location attached to it, then it does not appear in the map. You can view these events in alternate ways.

shortdesc.p: The user can change the way that they view the events from the timeline. The available options are a map, a list, and a grid view.

topicmeta.shortdesc: The user can change the way that they view the events from the timeline. The available options are a map, a list, and a grid view.

shortdesc.p: Users can search to narrow down or find a specific data point. The search function is accessed on the left side of Plot-It.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Users can search to narrow down or find a specific data point. The search function is accessed on the left side of Plot-It.

topic.title: Filter by Date of event range

shortdesc.p: The “Date of event range” allows users to adjust what events users see between a specific period of time.

topicmeta.navtitle: Filter by Date of event range
topicmeta.linktext: Filter by Date of event range
topicmeta.shortdesc: The “Date of event range” allows users to adjust what events users see between a specific period of time.

shortdesc.p: Users can narrow down what type of events appear in the timeline or the map by selecting from a list on the left side of the page.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Users can narrow down what type of events appear in the timeline or the map by selecting from a list on the left side of the page.

shortdesc.p: Users can filter what country events are located in, by selecting from a list on the left side of the page. This will narrow down the results in both the timeline and the map.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Users can filter what country events are located in, by selecting from a list on the left side of the page. This will narrow down the results in both the timeline and the map.

shortdesc.p: Users can reset both a search and searching filters in multiple ways. Once a user has reset or unselected the checkboxes, the timeline and map will re-populate with all events.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Users can reset both a search and searching filters in multiple ways. Once a user has reset or unselected the checkboxes, the timeline and map will re-populate with all events.

shortdesc.p: If you are not interested in using the timeline, or would like to just focus on the map/list/grid, you can hide the timeline.

topicmeta.shortdesc: If you are not interested in using the timeline, or would like to just focus on the map/list/grid, you can hide the timeline.

shortdesc.p: If you would like to work only with the timeline, or are not interested in the map/list/grid panel, you can hide that information.

topicmeta.shortdesc: If you would like to work only with the timeline, or are not interested in the map/list/grid panel, you can hide that information.

shortdesc.p: Plot-It allows users to view information in relation with its geographical and temporal location. Users can manipulate the timeline for a better view of the data points.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Plot-It allows users to view information in relation with its geographical and temporal location. Users can manipulate the timeline for a better view of the data points.

shortdesc.p: Users have the opportunity to view events in either the map, as a list, or in a grid.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Users have the opportunity to view events in either the map, as a list, or in a grid.

shortdesc.p: Events are located in both the timeline and the panel below. The event metadata provides more information about the event.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Events are located in both the timeline and the panel below. The event metadata provides more information about the event.

shortdesc.p: Users can search to narrow down or find a specific data point. The search function is accessed on the left side of Plot-It.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Users can search to narrow down or find a specific data point. The search function is accessed on the left side of Plot-It.

shortdesc.p: The CWRC-Voyant bridge serves to make it easy to create visualizations in Voyant based on individual or collections of documents in CWRC.

topicmeta.shortdesc: The CWRC-Voyant bridge serves to make it easy to create visualizations in Voyant based on individual or collections of documents in CWRC.
